00010 ##
00011 # pyp_classes contains two base classes that are used by PyPedal, the Animal() class
00012 # and the Pedigree() class.  What most PyPedal routines recognize as a pedigree is
00013 # actually just a Python list of Animal() objects.  An instance of a Pedigree() object
00014 # is a collection of METADATA about a list of Animals().  I know that this is confusing,
00015 # and it is going to change by the time that PyPedal 2.0.0 final is released.
00016 ##
00017 
00018 import string
00019 from time import *
00020 from numpy import *
00021

00027 #lang.install()

00029 # This will move somewhere else later, but for new set the test munging fprmat here.
00030 PYPEDAL_OUTPUT_TYPE = 'text' # 'html' or 'html'

00032 ##
00033 # The Animal() class is holds animals records read from a pedigree file.
00034 class Animal:
00035     """A simple class to hold animals records read from a pedigree file."""
00036     ##
00037     # __init__() initializes an Animal() object.
00038     # @param self Reference to the current Animal() object
00039     # @param animalID Animal ID number
00040     # @param sireID Sire ID number
00041     # @param damID Dam ID number
00042     # @param gen Generation to which the animal belongs
00043     # @param by Birthyear of the animal
00044     # @param sex Sex of the animal (m|f|u)
00045     # @param fa Coefficient of inbreeding of the animal
00046     # @param name Name of animal
00047     # @param alleles A two-element array of strings, which represent allelotypes.
00048     # @param breed Breed of animal
00049     # @param age Age of animal
00050     # @param alive Status of animal (alive or dead)
00051     # @return An instance of an Animal() object populated with data
00052     # @defreturn object
00053     def __init__(self,animalID,sireID,damID,gen='0',by=1900,sex='u',fa=0.,name='u',alleles=['',''],breed='u',age=-999,alive=-999):
00054         """Initialize an animal record."""
00055         self.animalID = string.strip(animalID)
00056         self.renumberedID = -999
00057         self.sireID = string.strip(sireID)
00058         self.damID = string.strip(damID)
00059         self.gen = gen
00060         self.igen = -999
00061         self.sex = sex
00062         self.by = int(by)
00063         self.fa = fa
00064         if self.sireID == '0' and self.damID == '0':
00065             self.founder = 'y'
00066         else:
00067             self.founder = 'n'
00068         # Take them out, put them back. Take them out, put them back...
00069         self.sons = {}    
00070         self.daus = {}    
00071         self.unks = {}    
00072         self.paddedID = self.pad_id()
00073         self.ancestor = 0
00074         self.name = name
00075         self.breed = breed
00076         # Assign alleles for use in gene-dropping runs.  Automatically assign two distinct alleles
00077         # to founders if no genotypes information is provided.  Otherwise, use the alleles passed
00078         # to Animal.__init__().
00079         if alleles == ['',''] and self.founder == 'y':
00080             _allele_1 = '%s%s' % (self.paddedID,'__1')
00081             _allele_2 = '%s%s' % (self.paddedID,'__2')
00082             self.alleles = [_allele_1,_allele_2]
00083         else:
00084             self.alleles = alleles
00085         self.pedcomp = -999.9
00086         self.age = age
00087         self.alive = alive
00088     ##
00089     # printme() prints a summary of the data stored in the Animal() object.
00090     # @param self Reference to the current Animal() object
00091     def printme(self):
00092         """Print the contents of an animal record - used for debugging."""
00093         self.animalID = int(self.animalID)
00094         self.sireID = int(self.sireID)
00095         self.damID = int(self.damID)
00096         self.by = int(self.by)
00097         print 'ANIMAL %s RECORD' % (self.animalID)
00098         print '\tAnimal ID:\t%s' % (self.animalID)
00099         print '\tAnimal name:\t%s' % (self.name)
00100         print '\tSire ID:\t%s' % (self.sireID)
00101         print '\tDam ID:\t\t%s' % (self.damID)
00102         print '\tGeneration:\t%s' % (self.gen)
00103         print '\tInferred gen.:\t%s' % (self.igen)
00104         print '\tBirth Year:\t%s' % (self.by)
00105         print '\tSex:\t\t%s' % (self.sex)
00106         print '\tCoI (f_a):\t%s' % (self.fa)
00107         print '\tFounder:\t%s' % (self.founder)
00108         print '\tAncestor:\t%s' % (self.ancestor)
00109         print '\tAlleles:\t%s' % (self.alleles)
00110         print '\tRenumbered ID:\t%s' % (self.renumberedID)
00111         print '\tPedigree Comp.:\t%s' % (self.pedcomp)
00112         print '\tBreed:\t%s' % (self.breed)
00113         print '\tAge:\t%s' % (self.age)
00114         print '\tAlive:\t%s' % (self.alive)
00115     ##
00116     # stringme() returns a summary of the data stored in the Animal() object
00117     # as a string.
00118     # @param self Reference to the current Animal() object
00119     def stringme(self):
00120         """Return the contents of an animal record as a string."""
00121         self.animalID = int(self.animalID)
00122         self.sireID = int(self.sireID)
00123         self.damID = int(self.damID)
00124         self.by = int(self.by)
00125         _me = ''
00126 #         _me = '%s%s' % ( _me, _('ANIMAL %s RECORD\n') % (self.animalID) )
00127 #         _me = '%s%s' % ( _me, _('\tAnimal ID:\t%s\n') % (self.animalID) )
00128 #         _me = '%s%s' % ( _me, _('\tAnimal name:\t%s\n') % (self.name) )
00129 #         _me = '%s%s' % ( _me, _('\tSire ID:\t%s\n') % (self.sireID) )
00130 #         _me = '%s%s' % ( _me, _('\tDam ID:\t\t%s\n') % (self.damID) )
00131 #         _me = '%s%s' % ( _me, _('\tGeneration:\t%s\n') % (self.gen) )
00132 #         _me = '%s%s' % ( _me, _('\tInferred gen.:\t%s\n') % (self.igen) )
00133 #         _me = '%s%s' % ( _me, _('\tBirth Year:\t%s\n') % (self.by) )
00134 #         _me = '%s%s' % ( _me, _('\tSex:\t\t%s\n') % (self.sex) )
00135 #         _me = '%s%s' % ( _me, _('\tCoI (f_a):\t%s\n') % (self.fa) )
00136 #         _me = '%s%s' % ( _me, _('\tFounder:\t%s\n') % (self.founder) )
00137 #         _me = '%s%s' % ( _me, _('\tAncestor:\t%s\n') % (self.ancestor) )
00138 #         _me = '%s%s' % ( _me, _('\tAlleles:\t%s\n') % (self.alleles) )
00139 #         _me = '%s%s' % ( _me, _('\tRenumbered ID:\t%s\n') % (self.renumberedID) )
00140 #         _me = '%s%s' % ( _me, _('\tPedigree Comp.:\t%s\n') % (self.pedcomp) )
00141 #         _me = '%s%s' % ( _me, _('\tBreed:\t%s') % (self.breed) )
00142 #         _me = '%s%s' % ( _me, _('\tAge:\t%s') % (self.age) )
00143 #         _me = '%s%s' % ( _me, _('\tAlive:\t%s') % (self.alive) )
00144         _me = '%s%s' % ( _me, 'ANIMAL %s RECORD\n' % (self.animalID) )
00145         _me = '%s%s' % ( _me, '\tAnimal ID:\t%s\n' % (self.animalID) )
00146         _me = '%s%s' % ( _me, '\tAnimal name:\t%s\n' % (self.name) )
00147         _me = '%s%s' % ( _me, '\tSire ID:\t%s\n' % (self.sireID) )
00148         _me = '%s%s' % ( _me, '\tDam ID:\t\t%s\n' % (self.damID) )
00149         _me = '%s%s' % ( _me, '\tGeneration:\t%s\n' % (self.gen) )
00150         _me = '%s%s' % ( _me, '\tInferred gen.:\t%s\n' % (self.igen) )
00151         _me = '%s%s' % ( _me, '\tBirth Year:\t%s\n' % (self.by) )
00152         _me = '%s%s' % ( _me, '\tSex:\t\t%s\n' % (self.sex) )
00153         _me = '%s%s' % ( _me, '\tCoI (f_a):\t%s\n' % (self.fa) )
00154         _me = '%s%s' % ( _me, '\tFounder:\t%s\n' % (self.founder) )
00155         _me = '%s%s' % ( _me, '\tAncestor:\t%s\n' % (self.ancestor) )
00156         _me = '%s%s' % ( _me, '\tAlleles:\t%s\n' % (self.alleles) )
00157         _me = '%s%s' % ( _me, '\tRenumbered ID:\t%s\n' % (self.renumberedID) )
00158         _me = '%s%s' % ( _me, '\tPedigree Comp.:\t%s\n' % (self.pedcomp) )
00159         _me = '%s%s' % ( _me, '\tBreed:\t%s' % (self.breed) )
00160         _me = '%s%s' % ( _me, '\tAge:\t%s' % (self.age) )
00161         _me = '%s%s' % ( _me, '\tAlive:\t%s' % (self.alive) )
00162 
00163         return _me
00164     ##
00165     # trap() checks for common errors in Animal() objects
00166     # @param self Reference to the current Animal() object
00167     def trap(self):
00168         """Trap common errors in pedigree file entries."""
00169         if int(self.animalID) == int(self.sireID):
00170             print '[ERROR]: Animal %s has an ID number equal to its sire\'s ID (sire ID %s).\n' % (self.animalID,self.sireID)
00171         if int(self.animalID) == int(self.damID):
00172             print '[ERROR]: Animal %s has an ID number equal to its dam\'s ID (dam ID %s).\n' % (self.animalID,self.damID)
00173         if int(self.animalID) < int(self.sireID):
00174             print '[ERROR]: Animal %s is older than its sire (sire ID %s).\n' % (self.animalID,self.sireID)
00175         if int(self.animalID) < int(self.damID):
00176             print '[ERROR]: Animal %s is older than its dam (dam ID %s).\n' % (self.animalID,self.damID)
00177 
00178     ##
00179     # pad_id() takes an Animal ID, pads it to fifteen digits, and prepends the birthyear
00180     # (or 1950 if the birth year is unknown).  The order of elements is: birthyear, animalID,
00181     # count of zeros, zeros.
00182     # @param self Reference to the current Animal() object
00183     # @return A padded ID number that is supposed to be unique across animals
00184     # @defreturn integer
00185     def pad_id(self):
00186         """Take an Animal ID, pad it to fifteen digits, and prepend the birthyear (or 1950 if the birth year is unknown)"""
00187         l = len(self.animalID)
00188         pl = 15 - l - 1
00189         if pl > 0:
00190             zs = '0'*pl
00191             pid = '%s%s%s%s' % (self.by,zs,self.animalID,l)
00192         else:
00193             pid = '%s%s%s' % (self.by,self.animalID,l)
00194         return pid
00195 
00196 ##
00197 # The Pedigree() class stores metadata about pedigrees.  Hopefully this will help improve performance in some procedures,
00198 # as well as provide some useful summary data.
00199 class Pedigree:
00200     """A class to hold metadata about pedigrees.  Hopefully this will help improve performance in some procedures, as well as
00201     provide some useful summary data."""
00202     ##
00203     # __init__() initializes a Pedigree metata object.
00204     # @param self Reference to the current Pedigree() object
00205     # @param myped A PyPedal pedigree
00206     # @param inputfile The name of the file from which the pedigree was loaded
00207     # @param name The name assigned to the PyPedal pedigree
00208     # @param pedcode The format code for the PyPedal pedigree
00209     # @param reord Flag indicating whether or not the pedigree is reordered (0|1)
00210     # @param renum Flag indicating whether or not the pedigree is renumbered (0|1)
00211     # @return An instance of a Pedigree() object populated with data
00212     # @defreturn object
00213     def __init__(self,myped,inputfile,name,pedcode='asd',reord=0,renum=0,debug=0):
00214         """Initialize a pedigree record."""
00215         if debug == 1:
00216             print '\t\t[DEBUG]:  Instantiating a new Pedigree() object...'
00217         if debug == 1:
00218             print '\t\t[DEBUG]:  Naming the Pedigree()...'
00219             self.name = name
00220         if debug == 1:
00221             print '\t\t[DEBUG]:  Assigning a filename...'
00222             self.filename = inputfile
00223         if debug == 1:
00224             print '\t\t[DEBUG]:  Attaching a pedigree...'
00225             self.myped = myped
00226         if debug == 1:
00227             print '\t\t[DEBUG]:  Setting the pedcode...'
00228             self.pedcode = pedcode
00229         if debug == 1:
00230             print '\t\t[DEBUG]:  Counting the number of animals in the pedigree...'
00231             self.num_records = len(self.myped)
00232         if debug == 1:
00233             print '\t\t[DEBUG]:  Counting and finding unique sires...'
00234             self.num_unique_sires, self.unique_sire_list = self.nus()
00235         if debug == 1:
00236             print '\t\t[DEBUG]:  Counting and finding unique dams...'
00237             self.num_unique_dams, self.unique_dam_list = self.nud()
00238         if debug == 1:
00239             print '\t\t[DEBUG]:  Setting reord flag...'
00240             self.reordered = reord
00241         if debug == 1:
00242             print '\t\t[DEBUG]:  Setting renum flag...'
00243             self.renumbered = renum
00244         if debug == 1:
00245             print '\t\t[DEBUG]:  Counting and finding unique generations...'
00246             self.num_unique_gens, self.unique_gen_list = self.nug()
00247         if debug == 1:
00248             print '\t\t[DEBUG]:  Counting and finding unique birthyears...'
00249             self.num_unique_years, self.unique_year_list = self.nuy()
00250         if debug == 1:
00251             print '\t\t[DEBUG]:  Counting and finding unique founders...'
00252             self.num_unique_founders, self.unique_founder_list = self.nuf()
00253         if debug == 1:
00254             print '\t\t[DEBUG]:  Detaching pedigree...'
00255             self.myped = []
00256     ##
00257     # printme() prints a summary of the metadata stored in the Pedigree() object.
00258     # @param self Reference to the current Pedigree() object
00259     def printme(self):
00260         """Print the pedigree metadata."""
00261         print 'PEDIGREE %s (%s)' % (self.name,self.filename)
00262         print '\tRecords:\t\t%s' % (self.num_records)
00263         print '\tUnique Sires:\t\t%s' % (self.num_unique_sires)
00264         print '\tUnique Dams:\t\t%s' % (self.num_unique_dams)
00265         print '\tUnique Gens:\t\t%s' % (self.num_unique_gens)
00266         print '\tUnique Years:\t\t%s' % (self.num_unique_years)
00267         print '\tUnique Founders:\t%s' % (self.num_unique_founders)
00268         print '\tPedigree Code:\t\t%s' % (self.pedcode)
00269     ##
00270     # stringme() returns a summary of the metadata stored in the pedigree as
00271     # a string.
00272     # @param self Reference to the current Pedigree() object
00273     def stringme(self):
00274         """Build a string from the pedigree metadata."""
00275         _me = ''
00276         _me = '%s%s' % ( _me, 'PEDIGREE %s (%s)\n' % (self.name,self.filename) )
00277         _me = '%s%s' % ( _me, '\tRecords:\t\t\t%s\n' % (self.num_records) )
00278         _me = '%s%s' % ( _me, '\tUnique Sires:\t\t%s\n' % (self.num_unique_sires) )
00279         _me = '%s%s' % ( _me, '\tUnique Dams:\t\t%s\n' % (self.num_unique_dams) )
00280         _me = '%s%s' % ( _me, '\tUnique Gens:\t\t%s\n' % (self.num_unique_gens) )
00281         _me = '%s%s' % ( _me, '\tUnique Years:\t\t%s\n' % (self.num_unique_years) )
00282         _me = '%s%s' % ( _me, '\tUnique Founders:\t%s\n' % (self.num_unique_founders) )
00283         _me = '%s%s' % ( _me, '\tPedigree Code:\t\t%s\n' % (self.pedcode) )
00284         return _me
00285     ##
00286     # fileme() writes the metada stored in the Pedigree() object to disc.
00287     # @param self Reference to the current Pedigree() object
00288     def fileme(self):
00289         """Save the pedigree metadata to a file."""
00290         outputfile = '%s%s%s' % (self.name,'_ped_metadata_','.dat')
00291         aout = open(outputfile,'w')
00292         line1 = 'PEDIGREE %s (%s)\n' % (self.name,self.filename)
00293         line2 = '\tRecords:\t%s\n' % (self.num_records)
00294         line3 = '\tUnique Sires:\t%s\n' % (self.num_unique_sires)
00295         line4 = '\tUnique Dams:\t%s\n' % (self.num_unique_dams)
00296         line5 = '\tPedigree Code:\t%s\n' % (self.pedcode)
00297         line6 = '\tUnique Founders:\t%s\n' % (self.num_unique_founders)
00298         line7 =  '\tUnique Gens:\t%s\n' % (self.num_unique_gens)
00299         line8 = '\tUnique Years:\t%s\n' % (self.num_unique_years)
00300         line9 = '='*80
00301         line10 = '\tUnique Sire List:\t%s\n' % (self.unique_sire_list)
00302         line11 = '\tUnique Dam List:\t%s\n' % (self.unique_dam_list)
00303         line12 = '\tUnique Gen List:\t%s\n' % (self.unique_gen_list)
00304         line13 = '\tUnique Year List:\t%s\n' % (self.unique_year_list)
00305         line14 = '\tUnique Founder List:\t%s\n' % (self.num_founder_list)
00306         aout.write(line1)
00307         aout.write(line2)
00308         aout.write(line3)
00309         aout.write(line4)
00310         aout.write(line5)
00311         aout.write(line6)
00312         aout.write(line7)
00313         aout.write(line8)
00314         aout.write(line9)
00315         aout.write(line10)
00316         aout.write(line11)
00317         aout.write(line12)
00318         aout.write(line13)
00319         aout.write(line14)
00320         aout.close()
00321 
00322     ##
00323     # nus() returns the number of unique sires in the pedigree along with a list of the sires
00324     # @param self Reference to the current Pedigree() object
00325     # @return The number of unique sires in the pedigree and a list of those sires
00326     # @defreturn integer-and-list
00327     def nus(self):
00328         """Count the number of unique sire IDs in the pedigree.  Returns an integer count and a Python list of the
00329         unique sire IDs."""
00330         siredict = {}
00331         for l in range(self.num_records):
00332             if int(self.myped[l].sireID) != 0:
00333                 try:
00334                     _s = siredict[self.myped[l].sireID]
00335                 except KeyError:
00336                     siredict[self.myped[l].sireID] = self.myped[l].sireID
00337         n = len(siredict.keys())
00338         return n, siredict.keys()
00339     ##
00340     # nud() returns the number of unique dams in the pedigree along with a list of the dams
00341     # @param self Reference to the current Pedigree() object
00342     # @return The number of unique dams in the pedigree and a list of those dams
00343     # @defreturn integer-and-list
00344     def nud(self):
00345         """Count the number of unique dam IDs in the pedigree.  Returns an integer count and a Python list of the
00346         unique dam IDs."""
00347         damdict = {}
00348         for l in range(self.num_records):
00349             if int(self.myped[l].damID) != 0:
00350                 try:
00351                     _d = damdict[self.myped[l].damID]
00352                 except KeyError:
00353                     damdict[self.myped[l].damID] = self.myped[l].damID
00354         n = len(damdict.keys())
00355         return n, damdict.keys()
00356     ##
00357     # nug() returns the number of unique generations in the pedigree along with a list of the generations
00358     # @param self Reference to the current Pedigree() object
00359     # @return The number of unique generations in the pedigree and a list of those generations
00360     # @defreturn integer-and-list
00361     def nug(self):
00362         """Count the number of unique generations in the pedigree.  Returns an integer count and a Python list of the unique generations."""
00363         gendict = {}
00364         for l in range(self.num_records):
00365             try:
00366                 _g = gendict[self.myped[l].gen]
00367             except KeyError:
00368                 gendict[self.myped[l].gen] = self.myped[l].gen
00369         n = len(gendict.keys())
00370         return n, gendict.keys()
00371     ##
00372     # nuy() returns the number of unique birthyears in the pedigree along with a list of the birthyears
00373     # @param self Reference to the current Pedigree() object
00374     # @return The number of unique birthyears in the pedigree and a list of those birthyears
00375     # @defreturn integer-and-list
00376     def nuy(self):
00377         """Count the number of unique birth years in the pedigree.  Returns an integer count and a Python list of the
00378         unique birth years."""
00379         yeardict = {}
00380         for l in range(self.num_records):
00381             try:
00382                 _y = yeardict[self.myped[l].by]
00383             except KeyError:
00384                 yeardict[self.myped[l].by] = self.myped[l].by
00385         n = len(yeardict.keys())
00386         return n, yeardict.keys()
00387     ##
00388     # nuf() returns the number of unique founders in the pedigree along with a list of the founders
00389     # @param self Reference to the current Pedigree() object
00390     # @return The number of unique founders in the pedigree and a list of those founders
00391     # @defreturn integer-and-list
00392     def nuf(self):
00393         """Count the number of unique founders in the pedigree."""
00394         founderdict = {}
00395         for l in range(self.num_records):
00396             if self.myped[l].founder == 'y':
00397                 try:
00398                     _f = founderdict[self.myped[l].animalID]
00399                 except KeyError:
00400                     founderdict[self.myped[l].animalID] = self.myped[l].animalID
00401         n = len(founderdict.keys())
00402         return n, founderdict.keys()
